title: Congratulating Rhonda A. Lewis upon the occasion of graduating from NeighborWorks Achieving Excellence in Community Development program
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION congratulating Rhonda A. Lewis upon the occasion
of graduating  from  NeighborWorks  Achieving  Excellence  in  Community
Development program

WHEREAS,  From  time to time this Legislative Body takes note of certain
extraordinary individuals  it  wishes  to  recognize  for  their  valued
contributions  to  the  success  and  progress  of  society and publicly
acknowledge their endeavors which have enhanced the basic humanity among
us all; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to congratu-
late Rhonda A. Lewis upon the occasion of graduating from  NeighborWorks
Achieving Excellence in Community Development program; and
  WHEREAS,  Rhonda Lewis has served as President & Chief Executive Offi-
cer of Bridge Street Development Corp. (BSDC) since 2001;  a  native  of
the  Brownsville  section  of Brooklyn, she has made rebuilding New York
City's most distressed neighborhoods her life's work; in the  course  of
her  25  years  in  real  estate and economic development, Ms. Lewis has
underwritten close to $100 million in  loans  and  grants  to  community
groups;  at  BSDC,  she  has created more than 600 units of mixed-income
housing as well as programs ranging from  commercial  revitalization  to
financial literacy to civic engagement and education; and
  WHEREAS,  On  March 4, 2010, Rhonda Lewis graduated from the Neighbor-
Works Achieving Excellence in Community Development program  in  collab-
oration  with  Harvard University's Kennedy School of Government; she is
one of 49 leaders to graduate with this Achieving Excellence class --  a
prestigious  and  highly selective training program for nonprofit execu-
tives offered by NeighborWorks America in collaboration with the Kennedy
School of Government; and
  WHEREAS, Only the most experienced and sophisticated executive  direc-
tors  and  senior  level  staff  participate in this program, and Rhonda
Lewis' successful completion of the Achieving Excellence  program  is  a
testament  to her exceptional skills and long-term commitment to improv-
ing our nation's lower-income communities and the lives of  their  resi-
dents; and
  WHEREAS, Rhonda A. Lewis's distinguished record merits the recognition
and respectful tribute of this Legislative Body; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate Rhonda A. Lewis upon the occasion of graduating from Neigh-
borWorks Achieving Excellence in Community Development program;  and  be
it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Rhonda A. Lewis.
